meanings.definition: A person with the ability or power to control or use something.
meanings.sent1: The young magician quickly became a masters of card tricks.
meanings.sent2: The CEO was the masters of the company's future direction.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was the masters of the house, demanding treats all day.
meanings.sent4: She became a masters of persuasion, convincing everyone to join her cause.
meanings.sent5: The masters of the game always knew the best strategies to win.

meanings.definition: A person who has complete control over a situation or activity.
meanings.sent1: The coach was the masters of the team's training schedule.
meanings.sent2: The dictator considered himself the masters of the entire country.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought he was the masters of bedtime, refusing to sleep early.
meanings.sent4: She became the masters of the kitchen, creating delicious meals effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The masters of ceremonies kept the event running smoothly.

meanings.definition: A person who has achieved a high level of skill or knowledge in a particular subject or activity.
meanings.sent1: The artist was a masters of painting landscapes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist became a masters of genetic research.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was a masters at stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: She was a masters of time management, always finishing tasks ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: The masters of the craft shared their expertise with eager apprentices.
